intro: Euonymus potingensis, commonly known as the Potingen euonymus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive seed structures. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in the wild.
